meanings.definition: To obtain or collect (something) with difficulty or effort, often by searching or begging.
meanings.sent1: She was scrounging for spare change in the couch cushions.
meanings.sent2: The raccoon was scrounging through the trash for food.
meanings.sent3: After scrounging for hours, he finally found his lost keys.
meanings.sent4: The detective was scrounging for clues at the crime scene.
meanings.sent5: Scrounging for firewood in the forest, she stumbled upon a hidden clearing.

meanings.definition: To seek to obtain at the expense or through the generosity of others.
meanings.sent1: He was always scrounging for free snacks from his friends.
meanings.sent2: She felt guilty for scrounging off her parents all the time.
meanings.sent3: The cat was scrounging for attention by knocking things off the table.
meanings.sent4: The politician was scrounging for votes in the upcoming election.
meanings.sent5: Scrounging for compliments, she wore her new dress to the party.

meanings.definition: To gather or collect (something) by searching or scavenging.
meanings.sent1: The birds were scrounging for twigs to build their nest.
meanings.sent2: He enjoyed scrounging for unique items at the flea market.
meanings.sent3: The kids were scrounging for seashells along the beach.
meanings.sent4: She was scrounging for information to complete her research project.
meanings.sent5: Scrounging for supplies, the survivors built a makeshift shelter in the forest.
